# Chapter 7

# Relying on Effort


- Laziness is an enemy of effort



- Four Powers that assisting in working for the benefit of others:
    - Power of Aspiration
        - Contemplating the benefits of virtuous actions and fearing the cycle of suffering
    - Power of Self-confidence
        - Springs from first assessing my abilities and focusing my efforts on the things I am capable of achieving until they are accomplished
        - Maintain confidence in thre things: my dharma practice, my dharma activities, and overcoming my own delusions
        - “I alone will lead all living beings to the happiness of enlightenment”
        - Confidence inspiration
        
        
        - “I will conquer all obstacles and none shall conquer me.”
        - Acknowledge the difference between self-importance and self-confidence
            - “This is not about me”
        - 
    - Power of Joy
        - Sorrow easily takes over the mind when it is not filled with joy
        
        
        - 
    - Power of Rejection
- The root of dharma is the intention to practice it and this is created by meditating on karma

NOTES ON CHAPTER:

1. Effort must be put into the practice of dharma in order to stay on a path and grow my flame.
2. Aspiration, to me, is the desire to be bodhisattva derived from an intentional contemplation of the path I am on. Always looking ahead at the brighter lights who have come before.
3. Self-confidence is the strength that is born of that aspiration that reminds me that I standing in power that has been discovered and refined for our kind throughout time immemorial and is guaranteed to free us all. This is my turn to grow the light of the path. This must be tempered with the knowledge that this is a privilege of service and not a place to worship myself. 
4. Power of Joy seems self explanatory but I think that from the aspiration (seed) grew the self-confidence. With much water (contemplation and practice) this flower has blossomed in the light of the path. This bloom is the beauty of joy. Boundless happiness for the path and all the humans on it. 
5.
